definition: both sides suffer (idiom)/neither side wins
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
entirely/without exception/(literary) to be together/to be alike
to injure/injury/wound

sentences.english: Both of them were weakened by the war.; Neither side gained in the war.
sentences.chinese: 在那場戰爭中他們兩敗俱傷。

sentences.english: The once, seem to be miserable, eventually internecine.
sentences.chinese: 那個曾經，似乎慘不忍睹，最終兩敗俱傷。

sentences.english: The beginning of aestheticism, internecine ending.
sentences.chinese: 唯美的開始，兩敗俱傷的結局。

sentences.english: Get the south and north side gangs to kill each other so someone else can take over.
sentences.chinese: 讓南北兩邊的人殺個兩敗俱傷然後某個人坐收漁利。

sentences.english: A war with America would be "lose-lose", but China should not be afraid of it.
sentences.chinese: 中美之戰必然會兩敗俱傷，但是中國不要畏懼。

definition: covered all over with cuts and bruises/beaten black and blue/be a mass of bruises
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to massacre one another (idiom); internecine strife
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
lit. two armies have equivalent banners and drums (idiom); fig. evenly matched/roughly comparable (opponents)
use both carrot and stick/use gentle methods and force/an iron hand in a velvet glove
to fawn on/to curry favor with/to make up to
to work to no avail (idiom)
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
to speak incoherently/to ramble/to talk irresponsibly
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
stake (in a gamble)/(what is at) stake
bruised/riddled with scars
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to suffer defeat in every battle (idiom)
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
